Battle Ringers' Site Map

The site map - the page for the curious, the lost, those reading every page and those who accidentally clicked the wrong link. Ah-ha. HELLO... :-)




welcome - the 'Hello' page. You probably started here - a simple introduction to this whole site. Looks quite pretty, but serves no real purpose.



 welcome
ringers news/latest - the page where all details remain as current as possible.

Use this page to find out about the slightly different things that the Battle Bell Ringers have done recently and will be doing soon.



ringers news/latest
  • outing 2002
history of bell ringing - just a short history of bell ringing in Sussex. If you have any information to expand and improve these details, feel free to email/mention it to me.



history of bell ringing
what is bell ringing - taking the minds of non-ringers (and ringers), from curious to, hopefully, having a basic understanding of how the bells and the ringing of them work in the church tower.

A quick plug - my home site has some further information, which explains a few methods for the early bell-handling learners.



what is bell ringing?
  • intro
  • how it works
  • methods
  • can i do it?
bells, us and practices - this page really should be the first stop for anybody wanting to ring at St Mary's, Battle. It gives a short introduction to the ringers of Battle, their bells and ringing times.

You also have access to contact information for 'selected members' of the band.



bells, us and practices
  • the ringers
  • the bells
  • ringing times
weddings and events - if you're a member of our band, or a local ringer, you can look here to check that all important wedding time. Also listed are details of outings, open days and any other 'special events'.

If you are not a 'local' ringer feel free to browse what we're up to, and come and visit us on one of our tower open days.



weddings and events
  • weddings
  • outings
  • open days
  • other
our peals and quarters - we don't ring many, but this should be a reasonably comprehensive list of the quarters and peal (intentionally singular), we have rung since 2002.



our peals and quarters
church and town - never been to Battle before?? Want to find out why the town and church were built?? This page is only brief, but offers a quick insite into Battle, including some links to external sites.

There are also links at the top of each page to take you to the Battle information centre.



the church and town
